private_information: Able to normalize action schemas and predicate inventories
action_analyst.goal: Derive a clean, machine-readable inventory of predicates, action schemas, arities, parameter roles, and object symbols from the public information without emitting PDDL.

private_information: Expert in grounding initial states and goals
Able to validate and normalize plans against given schemas without emitting PDDL
state_modeler.goal: Construct two normalized cases from the public information: Case A (with a provided plan) and Case B (without a plan). Provide initial facts and goal sets for both cases in a structured way, and give a light validation summary of the Case A plan.

private_information: Coordinates specialists to synthesize final artifacts
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the grounded actions and state models to produce a final PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem instance for Case B that is compatible with the FastDownward solver.

public_information: Available actions over objects: paltry(x,y,z), sip(x,y,z), clip(x,y,z), wretched(a,b,c,d), memory(x,y,z), tightfisted(x,y,z).
Action paltry o0 o1 o2 preconditions: hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, vase o0 o1, next o1 o2; effects add: next o0 o2; effects del: vase o0 o1.
Action sip o0 o1 o2 preconditions: hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, next o0 o2, next o1 o2; effects add: vase o0 o1; effects del: next o0 o2.
Action clip o0 o1 o2 preconditions: hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, next o0 o2; effects add: vase o0 o1; effects del: next o0 o2.
Action wretched o0 o1 o2 o3 preconditions: sneeze o0, texture o1, texture o2, stupendous o3, next o0 o1, collect o1 o3, collect o2 o3; effects add: next o0 o2; effects del: next o0 o1.
Action memory o0 o1 o2 preconditions: cats o0, spring o1, spring o2, next o0 o1; effects add: next o0 o2; effects del: next o0 o1.
Action tightfisted o0 o1 o2 preconditions: hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, vase o0 o1; effects add: next o0 o2; effects del: vase o0 o1.

Case A initial facts: cats object_0, cats object_1, collect object_10 object_3, collect object_11 object_3, collect object_6 object_2, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_3, hand object_12, hand object_13, next object_0 object_9, next object_1 object_9, next object_12 object_11, next object_13 object_7, next object_4 object_8, next object_5 object_11, sneeze object_4, sneeze object_5, spring object_6, spring object_9, stupendous object_2, stupendous object_3, texture object_10, texture object_11, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.
Case A goal: next object_12 object_10 and next object_13 object_9.

Case A proposed plan sequence: clip object_12 object_5 object_11; wretched object_5 object_11 object_10 object_3; tightfisted object_12 object_5 object_10; wretched object_4 object_8 object_7 object_2; clip object_13 object_4 object_7; wretched object_4 object_7 object_6 object_2; tightfisted object_13 object_4 object_6; memory object_1 object_9 object_6; sip object_13 object_1 object_6; memory object_1 object_6 object_9; paltry object_13 object_1 object_9.

Case B initial facts: cats object_0, collect object_10 object_2, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_1, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_2, hand object_11, hand object_12, hand object_13, next object_0 object_8, next object_11 object_10, next object_12 object_6, next object_13 object_9, next object_3 object_7, next object_4 object_10, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_8, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_10, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.
Case B goal: next object_11 object_8 and next object_12 object_8 and next object_13 object_10.
Universe of object symbols observed across cases: object_0, object_1, object_2, object_3, object_4, object_5, object_6, object_7, object_8, object_9, object_10, object_11, object_12, object_13.

ground_actions.system_prompt: You are an expert in planning formalisms. Do not emit PDDL. From the public information, extract a normalized inventory of predicates with arities and a precise catalog of action schemas (paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted) with named parameters, preconditions, and add and delete effects. Include the set of object symbols referenced.
ground_actions.prompt: Your name is action_analyst. Using the public information, compile a clean machine-readable description that includes: 1) predicates and their argument structure; 2) each action's parameter list and preconditions and effects; 3) the list of objects observed; 4) any simple invariants you can infer such as which predicates are binary or unary. Do not produce PDDL; produce a concise structured summary suitable for downstream synthesis.

case_a_model.system_prompt: You specialize in turning textual descriptions into normalized initial states and goals. Do not emit PDDL.
case_a_model.prompt: Your name is state_modeler. Build a normalized representation for Case A that includes: objects set, initial facts list, goal facts list, and the proposed plan sequence tokenized into steps with arguments. Summarize any obvious precondition mismatches or ordering issues you detect, but do not attempt to fix the plan. Output a compact machine-readable summary for the orchestrator.

case_b_model.system_prompt: You specialize in turning textual descriptions into normalized initial states and goals. Do not emit PDDL.
case_b_model.prompt: Your name is state_modeler. Build a normalized representation for Case B that includes: objects set, initial facts list, and goal facts list. Ensure fact names and arities match the grounded actions. Output a compact machine-readable summary for the orchestrator.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert PDDL integrator targeting the FastDownward solver. Produce a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem instance for Case B only. Use only STRIPS features compatible with FastDownward: include :requirements :strips, avoid negative preconditions, avoid conditional effects, avoid ADL. Action names must be paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted with parameters and effects exactly as specified by the grounded actions. Use the object symbols provided, and include in the problem the Case B initial facts and Case B goal conjunction. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Integrate grounded_actions, case_A, and case_B. Ignore repairing the Case A plan; it is for context only. Generate a clean domain that declares predicates: cats(x), hand(x), sneeze(x), spring(x), stupendous(x), texture(x), next(x,y), vase(x,y), collect(x,y). Define actions paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted exactly with their preconditions and add and delete effects from the grounded actions. Then generate a Case B problem named case-b over the full object set observed, initialize with Case B facts, and set the goal to the conjunction of next object_11 object_8, next object_12 object_8, and next object_13 object_10. Return only the two tagged blocks for use with FastDownward.
